Miles Sound System SDK 6.6h

Q:

How much CPU do the DSP filters use?

A:

The two built-in DSP filters are very fast!

The built-in global reverb is about as expensive as mixing each sample twice (which is almost nothing - a P3/500 will mix a sample using less than 0.25% of the CPU - that's one-forth of one percent).

The built low-pass filter is also almost free - figure less than 0.33% per sample on a P3/500 (one-third of one percent).

The other standalone DSP filters depend on what each actually does - the Dolby Surround is very cheap (less than the low-pass filter), but the Chorus filter is about 2% per sample. You can use AIL_digital_CPU_percent function to check the CPU hit of each filter.
